results.title: Burn, bury or what?
results.brief_description: Describes how the District of Columbia solved its problem of solid waste disposal by developing a technically sound long-range plan. Illustrates how other cities can solve solid waste disposal problems by using sanitary landfill, accomplished through the use of the latest engineering techniques.

results.title: Burn care: a life at stake
results.creator_credit: John Ralmon and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Aimed at teaching first aid for burns. Shows how to assess the extent and degree of burns, and how to treat thermal, electrical and chemical burns before medical aid is administered. Includes interviews with burn victims, medical photographs illustrating various kinds of burns and realistic dramatisations of burn accidents.

results.title: Burma: people of the river
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The varied regions and ways of living in Burma - the rivers that serve as highways; the rice fields in the delta and river valleys; jungle that yields harvests of teakwood and bamboo; the village life; and the city of Rangoon, centre of commerce, transportation and ancient culture.

results.title: Burma Railway
results.brief_description: A documentary covering the imprisonment of the ill-fated Australian 8th Division after the fall of Singapore in 1942, and the construction by the prisoners of war of the Burma Railway.

results.title: Burke and Wills
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
In 1860 Robert Burke and a party of explorers began the first overland crossing of Australia from Melbourne to the Gulf of Carpentaria. Both Burke and Wills perished on the way back. The film reconstructs the events that led to their deaths. This film is suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: Buried treasure
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Coal Utilization Council and Donald Carter
results.brief_description: An account of the British coal industry covering: the geological formation of coal; the layout and ventilation of a modern mine; the work of individual coal miners; the organization of the various shifts throughout the day; methods employed to extract coal from the coal face; cleaning, grading and transport of coal at the pit-head. “Supervised by the Coal Utilization Council in association with John Grierson and Arthur Elton”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gaumont-British Instructional, Coal Utilization Council and Donald Carter

results.title: Buried cities
results.brief_description: Shows the excavations and reconstructions of the cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum. Gives an account of the eruption of Vesuvius in 79 AD and depicts life at the time.

results.title: Bunyip
results.brief_description: Short Flash animation based around a bunyip, an Aboriginal mythical animal, that goes on a journey into town and encounters a drunken man called Larry. Intrigued by Larry, the bunyip sets out on a quest to eat him but has to face several ordeals before finally reaching the drunken Larry.

group.title: Top Screen 2007 VCE Media Interactive Works

results.title: Buns
results.creator_credit: Depicture Company, Oxford Films (U.S.) and Thomas Bammel
results.brief_description: Shows a large factory complete with automation and assembly line, producing hamburger buns. Covers each detail of this production from the giant kneader handling hundreds of pounds of dough to the automatic packaging and shipping. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Depicture Company, Oxford Films (U.S.) and Thomas Bammel

results.title: Bunraku: puppet theatre of Japan
results.creator_credit: Nichiei Kagaku Eiga Productions and Sakura Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Traditional performances at the Bunraku-za Theatre, Osaka, show the style of this unusual 18th century form, still popular in Japan. The Bunraku dolls, half life-size, create a make-believe world peculiar to Japan, and are so delicate that they cannot be imitated by live actors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nichiei Kagaku Eiga Productions and Sakura Motion Pictures
